reviewText: It's a best place to get some unique material made by the local people. They often organise various events as well which I appreciate. There is plenty of food options to taste.
Excellent Food Excellent Vendors always a great time live music fresh local products
Great various local made items and a large selection of locally grown vegetables and meats.

Lots of variety here with some very skilled local artisans present. You can find every sort of jewelry , trinkets , lotions , novels and the novelist , soaps , pet scarves and my favourite was the section where the lady makes the tote bags of various sizes , shapes and colours. I believe they were waterproof too. Going to see about getting one made to hold all my stuff. Allow lots of time to browse.It goes quickly.

While in town visiting I went out in the pouring rain just to attend this market. There is a nice selection of local vendors, though not as much as I had expected. I didn't purchase produce, but it all looked inviting. We ended up getting a great assortment of jams/relish, books, jewelry, treats and a great tea. Friendly and interesting vendors. Worth the time to drop in.
